meanings.definition: A sac in which spores are formed in fungi.
meanings.sent1: The asci contained many ascus filled with spores.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the ascus under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The ascus decided to throw a spore party inside itself.
meanings.sent4: The ascus was like a treasure chest full of tiny spore jewels.
meanings.sent5: The ascus looked like a tiny pouch filled with magical spores.

meanings.definition: A membranous sac in certain algae.
meanings.sent1: The ascus of the algae burst open, releasing its contents.
meanings.sent2: The ascus of the seaweed was studied by marine biologists.
meanings.sent3: The ascus algae played hide and seek with the other seaweed.
meanings.sent4: The ascus was a delicate bubble holding precious algae spores.
meanings.sent5: The ascus swayed gently in the water, releasing its algae spores.
